messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: private/public, it's still school
messages.messageBody:
on 8/6/02 11:34 AM, PSoroosh@... at PSoroosh@... wrote:

> I know - maybe too late for the Sacramento conference -- but maybe the South
> Carolina one or the one in Houston? I said I couldn't go to them, when the
> air rates were higher - but now I'm reconsidering!!!

Ooooo! Really? :-)

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: private/public, it's still school
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/6/2002 5:39:20 AM Pacific Daylight Time, ... They have airports, right? Have you had a look at airfares recently? Check out Southwest s
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/6/2002 5:39:20 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
tlandreth@... writes:


> I'd love to come to the CA conference that many of you will be at but
> I'm stuck in Nebraska. :-(

They have airports, right? Have you had a look at airfares recently? Check
out Southwest's rates!!!!

I know - maybe too late for the Sacramento conference -- but maybe the South
Carolina one or the one in Houston? I said I couldn't go to them, when the
air rates were higher - but now I'm reconsidering!!!

--pam

National Home Education Network
http://www.NHEN.org
Changing the Way the World Sees Homeschooling!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: private/public, it's still school
messages.messageBody:
<

But - my point is that it isn't the 'funding source' of the school that I
object to or that John Holt was writing about - it isn't because the public
schools are government-schools. My objections to "schooling" are just as much
relevant to private schools and to parents who use similar or even worse
method on their own kids at home.

>

I agree, Pam. I have the same objections. The private schools here (in
my limited experience) are exactly as you described. The parochial
schools use the same boring textbooks as the public schools (they go in
on the purchase orders together) and then they throw in the extra
religion class.

I'd love to come to the CA conference that many of you will be at but
I'm stuck in Nebraska. :-(

Suzy



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
